description: — These herd animals can be aggressive when protecting young and during the mating season, but they generally prefer flight to fighting. Camels are known for their ability to travel long distances without A bison stands more than 6 feet tall at the shoulder and is 9 to food or water. 12 feet long. It weigh 1,800 to 2,400 pounds. The bison’s statistics The statistics presented here are for the dromedary, or one- can be used for almost any large herd animal. humped camel, which thrives in warm deserts. A dromedary stands about 7 feet tall at the shoulder, with its hump rising 1 foot higher. It is stockier, slower (speed 40 feet), and has a higher Con- random direction (but always away from the perceived source of stitution score (16). danger). The save DC is Strength- 601–900 pounds. A camel can drag 4,500 pounds. based.
